definition: to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: A family in Grain Valley, Missouri, is trying to adopt him, "We can love him."
sentences.chinese: 密蘇里州格萊因河谷的一戶人家嘗試收養他。

sentences.english: People who want to adopt orphans should have the ability to raise them, Chen added.
sentences.chinese: 陳還補充說，想要收養孤兒的人需要有撫養能力。

sentences.english: Soon she attracted the curiosity of the one-year-old baby ape she adopted.
sentences.chinese: 這很快便引起了她收養的一歲小猩猩的好奇。

sentences.english: Ms Flatley said there were no national standards on adoption.
sentences.chinese: 佛萊利表示，對於收養，並沒有什麼國家標準。

sentences.english: The country is sharply divided over the issue of adoption.
sentences.chinese: 法國民衆在收養問題上則存在嚴重分赴。

sentences.english: The Viscount d'Epinoy was the first of several dignitaries to take up the savage girl's cause.
sentences.chinese: 德埃皮努瓦子爵是最早收養這個野女孩的權貴之一。

sentences.english: The Hague rules also govern the agencies’ accreditation.
sentences.chinese: 海牙規定也負責收養機構的資信。

sentences.english: Say opportunely opportunely , she is orphan, be adopted by person of a good intention.
sentences.chinese: 巧巧說，她是孤兒，被一個好心人收養。

sentences.english: When Victor's mother died from anthrax, Fredy came along and adopted him.
sentences.chinese: 維克多的媽媽得炭疽病死後，佛雷迪就收養了他。

sentences.english: Then one day, a divorced 41-year-old American showed up saying he wanted to adopt her.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，一個41歲的美國離異男人表示要收養她。

sentences.english: Norrell, who was adopted from Mexico as a baby by a Californian family, had been in Antioch to attend a rehearsal for a friend's coming-of-age party.
sentences.chinese: 嬰兒時的墨西哥女孩諾雷爾被加利福尼亞一家人收養。

sentences.english: She adopted a child whose parents were dead.
sentences.chinese: 她收養了一個父母雙亡的孩子。

sentences.english: When I was near dead, he saved me, and fed me.
sentences.chinese: 在我快要死的時候，是他救了我，收養我。

sentences.english: The the China Center of Adoption Affairs(CCAA)does not accept the adoption documents directly submitted by single person.
sentences.chinese: 中國收養中心不受理個人直接遞交的收養文件。

sentences.english: The the China Center of Adoption Affairs(CCAA)does not accept the adoption documents directly submitted by single person.
sentences.chinese: 中國收養中心不受理個人直接遞交的收養文件。

sentences.english: Most of these adoptions create thousands of happy and successful families.
sentences.chinese: 大多數的收養創建了成千上萬個幸福家庭。

definition: to place in the care of sb (a child, pet etc)/to foster/to board out
to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
